title: Experiential Mathematics Learning Program for Practical Application: SPARRING Model-Based

context.additional_context: Experience-centered curriculum integrating theoretical learning and practical activities, focusing on mathematical problems faced by professionals in the workplace. Establishment of a self-directed learning environment using personal devices.

learning_goals: Learners can perform mathematical modeling processes with over 80% accuracy by analyzing real-world work-related cases
Learners can solve self-directed practice problems at least twice weekly and develop improvement plans through a SPARRING model-based feedback system
Learners can apply mathematical reasoning required for decision-making based on data analysis results with over 70% accuracy in team-based simulation evaluations
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
